Description:
Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a WSL process. This could indicate an attempt to evade parent/child relationship detections or persistence attempts via cron using WSL

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: WSL Child Process Anomaly
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((parent_process_path like '%\wsl.exe' or parent_process_path like '%\wslhost.exe') and ((process_path like '%\appdata\local\temp\%' or process_path like '%c:\users\public\%' or process_path like '%c:\windows\temp\%' or process_path like '%c:\temp\%' or process_path like '%\downloads\%' or process_path like '%\desktop\%') or (process_path like '%\calc.exe' or process_path like '%\cmd.exe' or process_path like '%\cscript.exe' or process_path like '%\mshta.exe' or process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe' or process_path like '%\regsvr32.exe' or process_path like '%\rundll32.exe' or process_path like '%\wscript.exe')))
